column4: im dpkg reconfiguring xorg.conf, anyone know how to find my "video card bus identifier" info?
yeah, but it doesnt seem to want to give me my PCI bus information, I tried -x and -G :/
0:2 would make sense, thats what my intel card is on my laptop at home, if i recall. your machine should be able to easily (and with less room for error) be able to identify the bus...
isnt it in a 3 number format though? xx:xx:xx?
so for my dkpg reconfigure xorg, do i just type in "PCI:0:2:0 then?
yeah, i'm sorry, i forgot. I wish i had my laptop here, but that should work
there needs to be an intel graphics channel....
aw crap, do i need to specify ram too?
how do i tell what my system currently has set for ram for my i845?
i never had any problems with the default allocation, but run 'man intel' and scroll through until you see the something about "Option VideoRam [size] "
glxinfo may also be helpful in finding that out
do you recommend upgrading from the i810 to the intel ubuntu drivers?
it wouldn't hurt, but probably won't add any functionality you don't already have. I have to use the intel drivers, (with a 2.6.22 kernel) because I have a GMA965.
any performance increase / stability issues you know about? :D
I had difficulties with agpgart (the name for the allocated shared video ram) with the intel drivers and a 2.6.18 kernel, but other than that, not really
